text: Not much of an aroma. Clear gold, color and a frothy white head. Has a nice complex combination of malt, spicy hops, and citrus tang. The finish is a bit spicy on the tongue. Solid Kolsch, very drinkable.

On draught at 1808 American Bistro. Clear deep golden color with a medium white head that evaporates steadily to a film. Short strings of lacing. Aroma of malt, grassy hops and fruit. Light-bodied with flavors of herbal hops, biscuit malt and a bit of citrus. The finish is mildly bitter with a grassy hop aftertaste. Decent overall.

It pours golden and clear with a white head that has good head retention. There is moderate lacing on the sides. The aroma features bread and herbs. There are low levels of spice and wheat in the background.The flavors are highlighted by the bread and herbal character. The spices are prominent as well with citrus in the background. There are also honey and wheat notes. There are hints of mint. It has a light body with a balance that leans slight towards the malt to start and towards the hops in the finish. Overall, this is an easy drinking beer with plenty of flavor.

Poured up a clear yellow color with a frothy white head that lasted with good lacing. Moderate balanced malt and fruity hop aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a fruity finish of moderate duration. Nice beer
Gold, Clear, Loose white head. Smells Grainy, corny, and lightly sweet. Taste is biscuit, grassy hops, and a touch of corn. Some subtle fruit notes, as well. Dryish finish.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2017 Draft at Kauffman Stadium. Pours clear gold with a white head. Too much going on to get an aroma. Initial taste is tangy, spicy, and lots of pale malt. Aftertaste is mild with a little pepper. Full body and zingy carbonation. Quite enjoyable!
Draft at Bru Craft. Clear gold pour with lasting off-white foam. Horseradish. Tangerine. Malty. Clean finish.

12 oz can from Half Time. 
Clear gold pour. Small head, mild lace. 
Crisp, herbal aroma. Some grass, grains. Solid mouthfeel. Pretty solid.

12 ounce can. Pours a bright honey gold color. Large rocky beige head. Dryish, metallic, bready malt nose. Soft dryish tart flavor. Honeyish malt and grassy hops. Crisp and refreshing. Light citrus hops in finish.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 12 oz can from Plaza Liquor in KC. Clear golden appearance with a fluffy white head. Mild aroma of bread, toasted grain, wheat and light hops (herbal, spicy, citrus). Similar flavor, adding a mild grainy sweetness and a light hop bitterness. Light, crisp and easy to drink.  A solid Kölsch overall.

Using European pilsner malt and malted wheat as a base, American Kölsch is bittered with Magnum hops and features herbal, citrusy and spicy notes from end of boil additions of Tradition, Saaz and Saphir. Pouring golden in color, the aroma is of bready malt punctuated by a slightly minty hop character. With a light to medium mouthfeel, American Kölsch delivers a honey-like malt sweetness that gives way to a crisp clean finish with a touch of lingering citrus/herbal hop flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour from a 12oz can. Clear deep golden brew with small head. Weak aroma of green fruit, grass, hints of spice and metal. Taste is mild sweet malt and weak tart hops up front with some spice, grass and dry citric notes in the finish. Ive been enjoying lighter brews these days and have no complaints about a beers that dont smack you across the head with hops. But this is a little too restrained and while the taste that is there is great, its so mild that if you werent looking for it you might miss it.
Taste: Caramel malt sweetness with some apple fruit notes, lite grains hops are tropical. Semi sweet cider nose. Gold, clear, Smaller head some ring lattice to lace. Medium/Lite body.

Boulevard may call it American Kolsch, but this beer could pass for the German article. It pours a straw-gold color with a white, foamy head. Bread-like malty nose. Honey-like pils and wheat malt flavors that finish with mildly bitter citrusy, herbal, and grassy hops. Finish is quick, clean, and dry. Some people say lawnmower beer in a degrading way, but American Kolsch would serve with distinction in that capacity.
Gotta say I really dont care about this beer. It has zero stand out features. The softness I expect of a kolsch isnt quite there. Meh

Clear, yella with a carpeting white head. Biscuity malt aroma with some herbal, citrusy hop zip. Flabby mouthfeel and generally bland except for continental-style bittering. Dry, not fruity or tart. Needs better carbonation or the retention thereof. Not terrible, just not exciting. On tap, Momos.
Draft pours golden with a white head. Aroma of bread, herbal and some caramel. Taste is sweet malts

Pours a half finger of head on a clear straw body.
Aroma is honey and dry grains. Mild, but good.
Taste is mild lemon bitterness, with a touch of honey.
Texture is crisp.

12oz can. Filtered orange body. Fading white head. A pretty decent Golden Ale, Kolsch I suppose. Bready, medium bodied, really easy to session on. Drinkable enough, but kind of bland and boring too, probably wouldnt revisit is that enthusiastically. Not enough malt. hop, or yeast depth to really keep me captivated.

on tap @ Vino Bellissimo / Lima OH --- Clear bright golden amber color, ivory head, lace bands. Taste is malt, medium fizz, and light hops. Just a bit of clay in the finish reminds me its a Kolsch. Usable, but at best, only average.
Grassy, dry, a bit fruity at the end, but overall a lot like a pilsner. Pretty good.

Pour is a clear golden with a large white head. Aroma has a decent bready malt with noble hops grassiness. Flavor is again dry cracker malt with a little honey sweetness. Finish has a little tongue tingling bitterness. Solid kolsch and great that its in a can for drinking during summer outdoor activities.

Pours an extremely clear, brilliant pale straw color. About three fingers off white head. Pretty good retention, light splotchy lacing. Good carbonation. Looks great.Aroma is malty, maybe a touch of wheat. If it were offered to me, I would guess it was a pilsner. Light spicy hops. Sparkling water.Taste is light and refreshing. Watery. Mild. Malty, a little spicy, but not bitter. It is a touch minty. Touch of lemon zest.Mouthfeel is light, crisp, semi dry. Carbonation elevates spiciness. Super easy to drink. Overall, very enjoyable. One I would buy again, and recommend.

Can - average size foamy head, medium clear straw/hold color, good balanced aroma and flavor with light may and earthy noble hops, crisp finish, good and refreshing overall, easy drinking 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can.

A- Grains, malty, grass.

A- Gold color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Mild sweetness, corn, malty, honey, subtle lemon.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, crisp finish.

O- A great Kolsch. While generally one of the styles that excites me less than most, this one grabbed my attention. Crisp, a bit dry, and balanced. As far as this style goes this one is near the top for me.

I had this at Townplace Suites in Springfield. Pours gold with a white head. Taste grain, grass, like light summery beer. I thought this was good. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate balanced malt and herbal hop aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer
Golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Straw, pils malt, lighter hop finish.

Deep straw/light amber, clear, tall head. 
Yeasty nose. 
Medium body, moderate flavor, somewhat rich but light and refreshing mouthfeel with just right carbonation and heat, nice balance, long palate. 
Dry but a hint of sweetness balancing the gentle bitterness, mildly crisp. 
Malty, yeasty, honeyed. 
Typical Kolsch, Boulevard again did not disappoint. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz. can. Clear golden, foamy white head. Aroma of malt, fresh cut grass. Taste was mild sweet, lemon, white grape.
Very clear and dark golden pour. Clean crisp light taste. Better than i expected for this style.

Earthy malty notes on the nose, with some hints of fresh bread. Nice clear light gold color with a frothy white head. Crisp, bready, sweet malt up front. Nice slightly pepper bitterness balances the sweetness nicely. Nice carbonation. Lighter mouth feel. FInsih is slightly dry and clean. Solid Kolsch!

12oz can. Crystal clear apple juice body topped by medium off-white head. Aroma is medium sweet, bread, light white pepper, mint. Taste is moderately sweet, floral, cracker/bread, some spicy. Light body, light effervescence.
Draught at Arcadium. Clean looking orange pour with hops and a nice floral note. Nice.

Blind tasted with 5 other "golden ales". Beers were 1. Ambar Pale Ale 1900, 2. Ballast Point Bonito Blonde Ale, 3. Uinta Golden Ale, 4. Port Huron Honey Blonde, 5. Great Lakes Lightkeeper Blonde Ale 6. Boulevard American Kölsch. Rater 1 scored them 526134, Rater 2: 651234, Rater 3: 652134, Rater 4 (ME): 625134.


355ml can. Gold pour. Mild aroma. Pleasant flavor. Herbal and grassy, extremely pleasant. Could drink this all day.


Post tasting thoughts:

Boulevard comes out with guns a blazing with this one. A quintessential beer for the summer.

On tap. Pours a clear golden color with an average head and bits of lacing. Aroma of light fruit, grassy and hint of malt sweetness. Taste of light fruit, light malt sweetness and grain. Mild bitterness and clean finish. Light body, smooth with a clean feel. Not a bad way to start the season.

Clear gold with a fizzy foamy white head and wet lacing. Aroma is crisp bready malt. Taste is rich, slightly sweet bready malt with a touch of lemon honey. Slightly bitter noble hop finish. Medium mouthfeel. Very good representation of the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can. Pours a golden color with white head. Grainy, earthy, straw aromas. Grainy, straw, malty, slight early flavors. All in all, pretty decent version of a kolsch, but not a top notch version.

12 oz. can. BBD 06 Jun 2017. Pours a medium, well retined, white head, with moderate lacing, over a clear gold (SRM 5) body......nose is light malts including light bread tones, with hints of pear, apple, moderate hop spice, balances......taste is dry with hints of pear, apple, mild malts, light herbal, and spice from the hops, finishing with light bitterness......mouth feel, light body, no alcohol, medium carbonation. This is a lovely example of a clean, crisp delicately balanced style with very light, appropriately, complexity in aromas and flavors. It is not a Winter beer. Above to pleasure, below to style. BJCP 9/3/16/4/8

Paid $8.50 for six 12floz cans. BBD 05.13.2017 imprinted on the bottom. Poured into a mug glass, and consumed 03.18.2017. Looks as it should, rich golden color with an adequate but not too much head. Smells like washed hair without shampoo. There is a tad of an astringent taste that more so than other kolsch beers Ive had before. This is too say it kinda tastes like carpet with some black table pepper mixed in. A fairly refreshing kolsch inspired American golden ale. Eh...Ill stick with Schlafly Kolsch for when I want a light body and clean flavored German American-made golden ale.

12 ounce can poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. The aroma is grainy and grassy. Moderately bready and sweet taste. Medium body and medium carbonation. Nice stuff.

12 ounce can. Pours a pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of malt, citrus, and grain. Taste is malt, grain, citrus, and some spice. Decent.Earlier Rating: 5/20/2016 Total Score: 3.4On tap at the Boulevard Tasting Room. Comes a mostly clear pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of malt, grain, and grass. Taste is similar. Enjoyable.

$1.75 bottle from Rio Hill Wine. Pours clear golden with an inch of white head. Citrus aroma, mostly lemon, lightly herbal too. Flavor is crisp grasses, light lemon (very light), light crust, cereal. Plain.

Can served in a glass, 
this beer was a mostly clear light yellow-gold in the glass with a touch of orange, the pour gave less than a one finger white cover of bubbles, 

the nose had malt and bread, a little apple and pear, light citrus hops that had faint herb tones, some malt and bread sweetness, 

the flavors were light malt with a touch of grain and bread, light citrus hops, some malt sweetness, 
there was a light hop bitterness with malt and some sweetness following, 

the mouth feel was light, it was creamy and a bit crisp on the tongue, there was average to lively carbonation, 

I think this beer had more hops than most Kölsch beers I have had, it was a nice drink.

As "Boulevard American Kolsch" from a can. Aroma is earthy hops, must, metallic, corn, wheat, not good. Appearance is golden amber, clear, white head. Taste is earthy hops, corn, slight clove, wheat" metallic, grassy, meh. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, metallic corn earthy aftertaste. Overall, not bad for the style.
Pours golden with a thin white head. Aroma is grainy, a little floral. Flavor is cereal malts, herbal hop, light lingering bitterness.
Fizzy yellow beer smell. Lots of carbonation in look and taste. Very clear, not alot of body. Would be low in my choices.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2017 Clear pale gold pour with a white head. The aroma has floral hops with faint herbs. It has a light, crisp body with lively carbonation. The taste is mildly bitter with a quick, dry finish.
Golden body on the pour. Soapy large bubbled white head. Aroma of cereal grain, honey, and white grape. Fairly true to style. Decent American attempt at a typically German style.

If only all pilsner type beers (I know this is American Kolsch) tasted this good... Really an easy drinking brew but a step, actually a couple of flight of steps, above your normal, yellow, grainy American beer many of us grew up with. Anyway, give it a shot.
Pretty descent. Has a nice smooth flavor and was very easy to drink. Good no special.

KC Air B&B bottle share. 
Pours a GOLDEN color with a medium sized head & some lacing on the glass. 
The aroma is malty & clean with some mild honey. 
 
The flavor is mildly bitter in an herbal way with some clean maltiness and some mild honey & a light sweetness. 
Chill

12 oz bottle pour, gifted by beastie. Thanks! Barely missed the best by. Hazy golden pour with a ton of foam head. Lemon grain, and juicy aroma. Refreshing, cool flavor with a crisp, easy drinking presentation. Has the makeup of everything I look for in a kolsh. Good summer beer.

Slightly hazy golden brew that smells of yeast, hay, and lemon. Taste is grains with a little bit of sour. Not exactly what I was wanting to cool my thirst. Glad I only have two more of them in the sampler to drink.

12 oz from bottle to kolsch glass. Hazy, golden, well carbonated, nice fluffy head. Nose is white grape, dry, a little yeast. Body is light and crisp. Taste is malty up front with a dry finish. A little wheaty, more white grape. Nice lingering finish.
Bottle. Barley malt and straw aroma. Golden yellow with nice white head. Mildly sweet lemon, barley malt, and mildly bitter straw/grass flavor. Okay body. Pretty solid.

Bottle - slightly hazy straw pour - one finger white head dissipates quickly into a film. Aroma is sweet malts, corn, rice, splash of citrus - pleasant if not remarkable. Flavor is a nice combination of sweet and mildly bitter hop notes...citrus evident. Palate is light bodied, but not too light...great summer beer. Admittedly, I am a fan of a good kolsch, and this was a nice rendition of the style.

[ keg ][ 4oz ][ @Boulevard ][ $? ][ snifter ][ 06.02.16 ]transparent straw, puffy white head lasts. Dusty soft wheat and rice. Grassy front palate, plenty of gummy esters, soft but nuanced with cracker and dry grain. Destroyed the KC Pils right next to it.

Bottle from Kroger. Clear straw colored with a pillowy white cap. Aroma of lemon, grass, grain and hay. Nice balance; the taste is clean and grainy, lightly sweet and bitter, and with a touch of black peppery spiciness. Crisp, lightly dry, and light bodied. Very solid kolsch.

Despite the fact that I am not a big Kolsch fan, this was a great specimen and highly representative of the Kolsch style. Very effervescent with hop and bright, lager-type feel and flavor. Good brew for Kolsch fans.

12oz bottle 5/19/16 (Jewel Mix A Six)-40° In Shaker-Pours golden with a small white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of lemon, grass, hay, and citrus. Taste of the same. This is not bad but I am not a fan of this style.
Bottle. Light body with decent citrus/straw balance. Grainy. Entertaining but not exciting. Or that may describe the style for me.

Bottle:
Pours clear, bubbling, yellow-gold with a tall, foamy white head.
Grain and grass scent.
Taste is sweet, grain malt, a touch of white fruit......
Mild and steady grass/straw bitter throughout.......very light.
Tasty, but not as crisp and bright as I prefer in the style.

12 oz bottle purchased as part of the Boulevard sampler pack at Total Wine in Bellevue, WAi. Brewed January 27, 2016 - BEST BY 06/25/16. Just hit the Seattle market. The pour is a clear golden yellow with a foamy one inch white head. A bunch of fine carbonation bubbles rise to the surface. Thanks Tim for all that, hate to write and copy&paste is so much easier. The aroma is malty and light noble grass. Flavor has a thicker crispness but a snappy thicker white bread and ample carbonation to cut though it. Pretty easy drinking, very well crafted "Kolsch." Maybe Amerikolsch is a better name.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: 12 ounce bottle into pint glass, best before 6/25/2016. Pours slightly hazy pale golden yellow color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense foamy lacing clings down the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of lemon, pear, apple, cracker, bread, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance of pale malt and light-moderate earthy hop/fruity yeast notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon, pear, apple, cracker, bread, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, pear, apple, cracker, bread, herbal, grass, and light pepper on the finish for a short bit. Very nice robustness and balance of pale malt and light-moderate earthy hop/fruity yeast flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from carbonation and bitterness. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 4.6%. Overall this is a very nice Kolsch style. All around good robustness and balance of pale malt, and light-moderate earthy hop/fruity yeast flavors; and very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Clear light golden with a thin foamy cap. Nice slightly fruity and grapey nose with a nice blonde toasty background. Clean German blonde malt with a nice gentle grassy fruitiness, mellow bready background. Clean slightly grassy finish.

The beer pours golden yellow with a white head. The aroma has bread, milk caramel, mild grassy hops and an overall smoothness. It has a light crisp body with fairly soft carbonation. The taste starts a bit drier with crackers, peppery spice, grass and sulfur. The finish is very dry with some rustic notes. Pretty good.

12 oz bottle purchased as part of the Boulevard sampler pack at Lukas Liquors in Kansas City, Missouri. Brewed January 27, 2016 - BEST BY 06/25/16. The pour is a clear golden yellow with a foamy one inch white head. A bunch of fine carbonation bubbles rise to the surface. The aroma is floral, grass, honey sweet and crisp fresh cereal bread malt. The taste is floral herbal grass up front, soft sweetness, bready malt and an earth mineral finish. The palate is medium to light bodied with active natural carbonation and the dry mineral finish. Super easy drinking, very well crafted Kolsch. Would love this to be a regular lineup beer.
Aroma is fruit, pale malts/bread sweetness and mild earthiness. The flavor citrus hops, fruit, pale malts and a very smooth finish.
